info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 7 at 11:14AM EDT until April 11 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
Salamonie River below Warren affecting Wells, Jay, Wabash, Blackford and Huntington Counties.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
Wabash River near Bluffton IN affecting Wells County.
Wabash River near Linn Grove affecting Adams and Wells Counties.
For the Salamonie River...including Warren, Portland...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Wabash River...including Linn Grove, Bluffton IN, Wabash, Logansport...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Wabash River near Bluffton IN.
* WHEN...Until early Friday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water reaching the bottom of the bridge at East River Road and 450 East. River Road and a few county roads are closed by high water.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Monday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM EDT Monday was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 515 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING
